title: London, BL, Add. 14631
Digital Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Library

Part of a life of Dioscorus I., patriarch of Alexandria, the successor of Cyril written by his disciple Theopistus, Θεόπιστος, ܬܐܘܒܝܣܛܘܣ (fol. 1b., 12a) in the Pentapolis or Cyrenaica, shortly after the death of Dioscorus
Extract from a letter of Jacob of Edessa to the deacon Bar-had-be-shabba, against the adherents of the Council of Chalcedon
Anecdotes of holy men and women, chiefly Egyptian, from the earliest times down to the end of the vth cent.
Part of a prayer
Questions addressed by the priest Sergius to John bar Cyriacus, bishop of Tellā, with the replies of the latter
Canons of John of Tellā
Questions addressed by the priest Addai to Jacob of Edessa, with the replies of the latter
calendar of Saints' days
Unspecified contents

finalRubrics: ܫܠܡ ܩ̈ܢܘܢܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܒܪ ܩܘܪܩܘܣ
otherLimit: ܗܝܕܝܢ ܐܬ݀ܕܟܪܬ ܡ̈ܠܘܗܝ ܕܐܒܐ ܕܝܠܝ ܕܐܬܢܒܝ ܥܠܝ ܘܐܡ̣ܪ ܕܩܝܢܕܝܢܘܣ ܪܒܐ ܐܬ̇ܐ ܥܠܝܟ. ܘܒܪܫܥܬܗ ܫ̇ܢܝܬ ܠܝ̣ ܠܦܢܛܐܦܘܠܝܣ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ̣ ܘܐܬ̇ܛ̇ܫܝܬ ܒܗ̇. ܘܬܡܢ ܐܟ̇ܬܒܬ ܠܗܕܐ ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܕܐܒܘܢ ܚܣܝܐ ܘܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܕܝܣܩܪܘܣ. ܘܡ̇ܘܕܐ ܐܢܐ ܩܕܡ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܫܪܪܐ ܐܟ݁ܬܒܬ. ܏ܘܫ.
